fr:
(Chant) Je viens
											de l'ancienne Virginie de l'est.
es:
(Cantando) Yo soy
											de la vieja Virginia del Este,
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en:
I met
											a fair, young maiden.
tr:
Orada açık tenli...
											...genç bir kızla tanıştım.
fr:
J'ai rencontré
											une belle jeune fille.
es:
Encontré
											una bella y joven doncella.
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en: Her name I did not know.
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en:
Don't that road
											look rough and rocky?
tr:
Bu yol çok taşlı
											ve zorlu görünmüyor mu?
fr:
Ce chemin
											n'a-t-il pas l'air
difficile et cahoteux ?
es:
¿Ese camino
											no parece áspero y rocoso?
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en: Don't that sea look wide and deep?
tr: Bu deniz çok geniş ve derin görünmüyor mu?
fr:
Cette mer n'a-t-elle pas l'air
vaste et profonde ?
es: ¿Ese mar no parece amplio y profundo?
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en:
Don't my darlin'
											look
											the sweetest ...
tr:
Peki ya sevgilim
											en güzel şey
											görünmüyor mu?
fr:
Ma bien-aimée
											n'a-t-elle pas l'air
											d'être la plus jolie...
es:
¿Mi tesoro
											no parece
											el más dulce
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en: When she's in my arms asleep?
fr: Quand elle dort dans mes bras ?
es: cuando se duerme en mis brazos?
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en:
Her hair
											was a dark-brown curly.
fr:
Ses cheveux
											étaient brun foncé et bouclés.
es:
Su cabello
											era rizado y castaño oscuro.
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en:
On her breast
											she wore a white lilly.
fr:
Sur sa poitrine,
											elle portait un lys blanc.
es:
En su pecho
											llevaba puesta una azucena.
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en: Through the night, the tears she shed.
fr:
Tout au long de la nuit,
elle a versé des larmes.
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en: Won't you take these words for me?
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en:
Take them back
											to old East Virginia.
tr:
Sözlerimi alın
											eski Doğu Virjinya'ya götürün.
fr:
Ramenez-les
											dans l'ancienne Virginie de l'est.
es:
Llévalas
											a la vieja Virginia del Este.
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en: Tell my darlin' she is free.
fr: Dites à ma bien-aimée qu'elle est libre.
es: Dile a mi tesoro que es libre.
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en:
That was a song called "East Virginia"
											I learned from a man named Clifton Hicks
											who lives down in Georgia.
											The next song ...
											I have for you
											is called "John Brown's Dream."
											It's an old dance tune.
											And you may notice that the banjo
that I'm holding looks a little different
											than banjos you might be used to seeing
											or the one I just played, for example.
											And this banjo
is sort of an earlier model.
											Banjos kind of evolved like a human has.
											And I like to say that the sound
that comes out of this banjo
											is a sound that was
just a little closer to the source,
											which is Africa,
											and some people forget that,
											so, yeah ...
tr:
Bu şarkının adı ''East Virginia''ydı.
											Clifton Hicks adında birinden öğrendim,
											kendisi Georgia'da yaşıyor.
											Sıradaki şarkı ise...
											Sizin için söyleyeceğim,
											adı ''John Brown's Dream.''
											Eski bir dans melodisi.
											Şu an elimdeki banjonun
görmeye alışık olduğunuz banjolardan
											biraz farklı olduğunu fark edebilirsiniz
											veya mesela az önce kullandığımdan.
											Bu banjo biraz daha eski bir model.
											Bu enstrümanlar da insanlar gibi evrildi.
											Söylemeliyim ki bu banjodan çıkan ses
											kaynağına biraz daha yakın,
											Afrika yani,
											bazı insanlar bunu unutuyor,
											durum böyle.
fr:
Cette chanson s'appelle « East Virginia ».
											Je l'ai apprise avec Clifton Hicks,
											qui vit en Géorgie.
											La prochaine chanson...
											que je vais vous chanter
											s'appelle « John Brown's Dream ».
											C'est une ancienne mélodie dansante.
											Vous remarquez peut-être que le banjo
que je tiens a l'air un peu différent
											des banjos que vous avez
l'habitude de voir
											ou de celui avec lequel
je viens de jouer, par exemple.
											Ce banjo est un modèle plus ancien.
											Le banjo a évolué comme l'être humain.
											J'aime dire que le son
qui sort de ce banjo
											est un peu plus proche de son origine,
											qui est l'Afrique,
											et certains l'oublient,
											alors...
es:
Esta canción fue "East Virginia",
											que aprendí de un hombre 
llamado Clifton Hicks
											que vive en Georgia.
											La siguiente canción
											que tengo para Uds.
											se llama "John Brown's Dream".
											Es una vieja melodía de baile.
											Y podrán notar que el banyo que llevo
entre mis manos es un poquito diferente
											de los que están acostumbrados a ver
											o del banyo con el que recién toqué.
											Este banyo es un modelo anterior.
											Los banyos evolucionaron 
como los seres humanos
											y me gusta decir que su sonido
											es más cercano a su origen,
											que es África, y hay gente
que se olvida de eso,
											así, que aquí va...
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en: John Brown's dream the devil was dead.
fr: dans son rêve, le diable était mort.
es:
el sueño de John Brown,
el diablo estaba muerto.
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en: I'm gonna get that, get that, get that,
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en: I'm gonna get that pretty little girl.
fr: je vais avoir cette jolie fille.
es: conseguiré esa niña pequeña y bella.
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en: John Brown's dream the devil was dead.
fr: dans son rêve, le diable était mort.
es:
el sueño de John Brown,
el diablo estaba muerto.
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en: Come on, Liza we'll be pickin' it again.
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en: I'm gonna get that, get that, get that,
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown

en: I'm gonna get that pretty little girl.
fr: je vais avoir cette jolie fille.
es: conseguiré esa niña pequeña y bella.
title: "East Virginia" / "John Brown's Dream"
speaker: Nora Brown
